result.execSummary:
The defendant Trisha L Knutson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

Consecutive to: Count 3 in Case 13CF1475.

superMiscConds.notes:
Fine is to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

DNA surcharge ($250) to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision. Reimbursement for Blood Draw costs ($35) to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for Waukesha County Sheriff's Department (to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision).
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.
Psychological evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No contact with Jay G., Dave C. and David K.
Provide DNA sample if not yet provided.
Attend a Victim Impact Panel each year of Extended Supervision.
Not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (for example, bars, taverns or liquor stores).
CORRECTED 12-05-2014:  Attend a Victim Impact Panel one time during Probation and Extended Supervision.

Case 14CF462 is dismissed and read in.

supervisions.notes: Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle OPERATED, TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Trisha L Knutson in court, in custody, with attorney Joseph Smith.   Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case called for sentencing.  
  The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

IMPOSED SENTENCE of: 

5 YEARS IMPRISONMENT (CREDIT - 0 days), consecutive to count 3 in 13CF1475.
  -  2 YEAR(S) OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  3 YEAR(S) OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION;

**D/L REVOCATION: 36 months;
**IGNITION INTERLOCK: 36 months;

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
*AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
*Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
*No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
*Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
*Maintain employment 
*No contact with:  Jay G., Dave C. and David K. 
*DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.
*Attend a Victim Impact Panel each year of probation.  
*Not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.
*No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
*No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).
*Psychological evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate.

FINE:  $1519 (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision);

DNA SURCHARGE:  $250 (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision);

BLOOD DRAW FEE:  $35 paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forward to City of Waukesha Police Department - to be paid as a condition of extended supervision

Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
